episodes.title: JW 2025 Growth Report EXPOSED — What They Left Out
episodes.description:
In this video, we take the 2025 Governing Body Update #7 and examine it clip-by-clip — using their own words — and compare it to what is missing, what is selectively emphasized, and what the real data reveals.

As predicted earlier this week, the new Broadcast is highly polished, emotionally warm, and full of carefully selected numbers. But what’s striking is not what they said — it’s what they didn’t say.

For decades, the annual Yearbook included:
• disfellowshipping totals
• reinstatements
• inactive publishers
• irregular publishers
• congregation growth AND decline
• youth retention
• regional breakdowns
• Kingdom Hall data
• attrition
• long-term membership trends

All of that transparency ended in 2016.

Today we get only:
• publisher totals
• baptisms
• Bible study counts
• Memorial attendance
• selective “growth highlights” from developing regions

Not a single Western country — where numbers are shrinking or flat — was mentioned.

For those who want to verify the trends independently, here are the direct Pew Research links (public, non-apostate sources):

📚 Pew Research — Verify the Data Yourself
• JW has the highest turnover rate of ANY religion (66% leave):
https://www.pewresearch.org/religion/2015/05/12/chapter-2-religious-switching-and-intermarriage/

• JW youth retention only 37% (63% leave):
https://www.pewresearch.org/religion/2015/05/12/religious-switching-and-intermarriage/#religious-switching

• JW age demographics + aging membership:
https://www.pewresearch.org/religion/religious-landscape-study/religious-groups/jehovahs-witness/

• Western JW decline (U.S. landscape study):
https://www.pewresearch.org/religion/2015/05/12/americas-changing-religious-landscape/

• Modeling the future decline of strict religions:
https://www.pewresearch.org/religion/2022/12/14/modeling-the-future-of-religion-in-america/

This rebuttal isn’t about attacking individuals — it’s about examining transparency, data, and patterns.
And when an organization reports only the numbers that look good, and hides the numbers that matter, it raises important questions the public deserves to consider.

Live your life with love.
We will see you on the next video — bye for now.

episodes.title: ⚡France’s MIVILUDES Targets Watchtower’s Abuse | Interview with Barbara Anderson
episodes.description:
In this powerful new development, France’s MIVILUDES — the Interministerial Mission for Vigilance and Combat Against Sectarian Deviances — is taking a firm stance against Watchtower’s coercive and abusive practices.

Veteran researcher and advocate Barbara Anderson joins Miss Usato of AVOIDJW to discuss MIVILUDES’ renewed focus on cultic control, France’s historic legal framework, and the growing international momentum toward protecting citizens from psychological abuse under the guise of religion.

From Paris to Nashville, this story bridges decades of activism — from Barbara’s 2009 meetings with French officials and the Vatican’s Don Minuti to the present day, as leaked 2025 elder letters reveal Watchtower’s growing fear of losing its religious status in France.

This is more than an interview — it’s a historic reckoning.

🗣 Featuring:
Barbara Anderson — Watchtower Documents
Miss Usato — AVOIDJW

🏛 Topics Covered:

France’s legal move to revoke JW religious status

The role of MIVILUDES in protecting human rights

episodes.title: 🟥 Kenai Jehovah’s Witness Leader Indicted on 20 Felony Sex-Crime Charges
episodes.description:
Former Jehovah’s Witness leader Aaron ‘Scott’ Merritt of Kenai, Alaska, has been indicted on 20 felony counts of sexual abuse and assault of minors. He pleaded not guilty at his arraignment on Nov 4 2025 and is being held on $250,000 bail. The congregation where the alleged abuse occurred has since been dissolved. This report summarizes the criminal charges and ongoing investigation.

Sources: Anchorage Daily News | KDLL Public Radio
